As I've made clear over the past several days, I will do everything I can to keep the government open.

Delay tactics and political posturing accomplish nothing and only cause more uncertainty for our constituents.

Time is running out - we need to pass a stopgap bill now.

It would also give Congress more time to work on long-term spending bills that fight inflation, secure the border, and support farmers and ranchers.

Unfortunately, my colleagues on the other side of the aisle are preventing the House from voting on it, with <10 hours to go.

Here's an update on where things currently stand:

House Republicans have put forward a bipartisan solution to fund the government for 45 days.

This would ensure there are no disruptions in government services for Oregonians.

During my tele-town hall Tuesday evening, 85% of Oregonians agreed that we need to work towards cutting spending and lowering our national debt.

I'm fighting to make it happen while also avoiding a shutdown.

I just supported an effort to keep the government open, but unfortunately it failed to pass the House.

My latest update on where things stand as we continue working to keep the government open:

If the government shuts down, I've ensured that my own pay will be withheld until we get the job done.

As long as federal workers, service members, and border patrol agents aren't getting paid, members of Congress shouldn't get paid either.

I'm frustrated that the current gridlock threatens important government services that Oregonians rely on.
